pros: Part time work, great coworker, good vibe.
cons: Salary, and lack of upward mobility.

pros: Great people to work with, self schedule, great boss.
cons: Low wages compared to other area hospitals, limited movement opportunities, no shift incentives, expensive healthcare options.

review_title: Nice place to work, but extremely low pay and no opportunity for advancement
pros: Tight knit community and good place to develop skills
cons: Difficult to advance, low pay

pros: A wide range of experience in the world of psychiatry with great co-workers.
cons: Pay is much too low for the heart and effort put forth.

pros: Coworkers are nice and funny Free food Free drinks
cons: Chaotic at times People call out often

pros: Enjoyable people to work with
cons: Low pay compared to other jobs

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Newburyport, MA
pros: If you live in the Newburyport area it is your community hospital. Nice patients Fun area to work and live.
cons: Lowest pay scale in the region Under staffed Short Nurses aids and techs Staff leaving for better paid opportunities at other local hospital. Turn over of Nurse managers Administration not supporting staff

pros: the people here are great - they are what keeps me going
cons: all departments are very understaffed

review_title: Love the people work there but no advancing opportunity
pros:
Coworkers were nice
Supervisor was awesome
Working Hours were great
cons:
HR doesnt help for career path
No advancing opportunities 
Working environment isn't great
Understaffed issues
Underpaid for too long
Health insurance was good but then they changed it

job_title: Food Service Organizer in Newburyport, MA
pros: We work as a team
cons: Severely short staffed, over worked and underpaid. Very hard to get raise.

pros: Enjoyed working with patients and for the most part was able to do my job without issue
cons: Management can be difficult to work under.

review_title: Not the great hospital it once was.
pros:
Small community. Decent commute. 
Foods good but very expensive for the amount you get. Gift shop is great. Easy to navigate.
cons: No transparency- benefits for most are awful. Disconnect between units. Disrespect between units. Patient care quality is getting worse but management  either dismisses you or doesn’t care.  Nurses are over worked. CNA’s  are quitting,  or calling out because they are overworked, and underpaid.

pros: Community based, friendly environment, and welcoming
cons: Lots of Traffic during summer vacations

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Newburyport, MA
pros: paid vacation time, friendly and supportive co-workers, great commute, nice cafeteria
cons: low morale, stress, poor communication from director, upper management distant and short sighted, short staffed, lack of confidentiality within administration

pros: Good pay, good benefits, good management
cons: Benefits used to be better

review_title: not a bad place to work if you live in the area and don't mind minimal advancement opportunity
pros: Nice location, little or no traffic getting around the area.  Lots of flexibility with work schedule.
cons: Management often seems clueless as to what the organization "really" needs. Too many chiefs, and not enough indians. Little or no job growth. Pay and benefits are average.

pros: Vacation cafe location, I'm not everyone fees stuck here.
cons:
You are penalized if you do not meet the NATIONAL BMI, if you have high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and if you smoke. Once I accepted to the job, I realized that I signed my life over to this hospital. They own you 24/7. Mark my words! They will monitor all of the above! They even control you on your
weekends.

pros: Great general staff, supportive and helpful-always willing to answer questions and very responsive.
cons: Benefits: ET/Medical/Dental-leave much to be desired. Some discrepancies amongst departments and the directors interpretation of HR policies.

pros: Lots of part time opportunities. Decent benefits. Convenient.
cons: Leadership is disconnected from reality. Poor collaborative, interdisciplinary efforts.

pros: Company with great community ties, family oriented, great benefits!
cons: There are no cons, this is a truly great company to work for!

pros: flexible hours during summer, understanding management, starting pay above minimum wage
cons: during the year they'll ask you to come in anytime you have a day off
